list-item.p: Hormel Foundation 5th Annual Gifted and Talented Education Symposium at the Riverland Community College in Austin, MN. For more information, please visit https://www.austin.k12.mn.us/educationalservices/GTsymposium/default.aspx

Global & Gifted 2013 conference at the University of Warwick in Coventry, United Kingdom. For more information, please visit https://www.iggy.net/globalandgifted
American Mensa’s 2013 Annual Gathering in Ft. Worth, TX. For more information, please visit http://ag2013.us.mensa.org/
PG Retreat for families with highly and profoundly gifted children at the Glyn Eyrie Castle in Colorado Springs, CO. For more information, please visit http://pgretreat.com/
PG Retreat for families with highly and profoundly gifted children at Breckenridge, CO. For more information, please visit http://pgretreat.com/
The 36th Annual Confratute Summer Institute at the University of Connecticut in Storrs, CT. For more information, please visit http://www.gifted.uconn.edu/confratute/

14th International ECHA Conference in Slovenia. For more information, please visit http://www.echa2014.info/
Alabama Association for Gifted Children (AAGC) Conference at the McWane Science Center in Birmingham, AL. For more information, please visit http://www.alabamagifted.org/
International Conference on Talent Development and Excellence in Education in Antalya, Turkey. For more information, please visit http://ictde2013.org/

boxed-text.title: Did you know . . .
boxed-text.p: . . . during the 2010-2011 school year, 82% of high schools reported that students were enrolled in dual credit courses.
. . . 69% of high schools reported that students were enrolled in Advanced Placement (AP) or International Baccalaureate (IB) courses.
. . . 59% of high schools reported that students were enrolled in both dual credit and AP and IB courses.
. . . 76% of high schools reported that students took dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 49% of high schools reported that students took dual credit courses with a career and technical/vocational focus.
. . . 63% of high schools reported establishing requirements that students must meet to take dual credit courses.

. . . 57% of high schools reported that transportation was needed for at least some of the dual credit courses with the following sources responsible for transportation costs: parents/students (86%), the school district (31%), and the state (5%).
. . . 45% of high schools reported that students and their parents paid full or partial tuition for dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 47% of high schools reported that students paid for books required by dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 43% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for partial tuition of dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 33% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for fees of dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 44% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for required books in dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 28% of high schools reported that students and their parents paid full or partial tuition for dual credit courses with a technical/vocational focus.
. . . 31% of high schools reported that students paid for books required by dual credit courses with a career and technical/vocational focus.
. . . 43% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for partial tuition of dual credit courses with a technical/vocational focus.
. . . 34% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for fees of dual credit courses with a technical/vocational focus.
. . . 44% of high schools reported that the school or district paid for required books in dual credit courses with an academic focus.
. . . 14% of high schools reported that some students who were enrolled in dual credit courses earned postsecondary certificates.
. . . 7% of high schools reported that some students who were enrolled in dual credit courses earned associate’s degrees.
. . . 93% of high schools reported that students enrolled in dual credit courses with an academic focus were awarded postsecondary credit immediately upon completion of courses.
. . . 85% of high schools reported that students enrolled in dual credit courses with a career and technical/vocational focus were awarded postsecondary credit immediately upon completion of courses.
. . . 61% of high schools reported that dual credit courses with an academic focus were taught solely by high school instructors.
. . . 67% of high schools reported that dual credit courses with a technical/vocational focus were taught solely by high school instructors.
. . . 69% of high schools reported that dual credit courses with an academic focus that were offered on postsecondary campuses enrolled both high school and postsecondary students.
. . . 62% of high schools reported that dual credit courses with a technical/vocational focus that were offered on postsecondary campuses enrolled both high school and postsecondary students.

Statistics from Thomas, N., Marken, S., Gray, L., & Lewis, L. (2013). Dual credit and exam-based courses in U.S. public high schools: 2010-2011 (NCES 2013-001). U.S. Department of Education. Washington, DC: National Center for Education Statistics. Retrieved from http://nces.ed.gov/pubsearch
